TicTac4

Class BigBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • TicTac4.BigBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    class BigBoard
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This is the only JFrame for Tic-Tac-4. It holds the content JPanel, which creates a 3x3 grid of Connect-4 games. Each Connect-4 game is housed inside of another JPanel, inside of said grid. This class is used to set up the JFrame and create each JPanel needed. It contains functions used to determine if a user has won the game.

        Parameters:

      • checkWinners

        private void checkWinners()
        This function is to check the winners matrix, seeing if there is a Tic-Tac-Toe winner or if the game is a tie.

      • getColorName

        private java.lang.String getColorName(java.awt.Color c)
        This function gives a String value of the color - probably should have just overridden the Color class' toString
        Parameters:
        c - The color who's name should be returned
        Returns:
        The String corresponding with the possible winning colors

      • freezeAll

        private void freezeAll()
        Freezes all Connect-4 games, loops through each panel and calls the setEditable method.

      • isWinnersFull

        private java.lang.Boolean isWinnersFull()
        This function is used to determine if the matrix that holds each Connect-4 game's winning color is full.
        Returns:
        True if it is full, false otherwise

      • tic_tac_toe_row

        private java.lang.Boolean tic_tac_toe_row(java.awt.Color tic,
                                          java.awt.Color tac,
                                          java.awt.Color toe)
        Check three values to see if they are the same. If so, we have a winner for Tic-Tac-4 This function was borrowed from: http://www.coderslexicon.com/code/15/
        Parameters:
        tic - The first winning color
        tac - The second winning color
        toe - The third winning color
        Returns:
        True if each color is equal, false otherwise

      • tic_tac_toe_win

        private java.awt.Color tic_tac_toe_win(java.awt.Color[][] grid)
        Goes through each possible winning Tic-Tac-Toe combination and calls another function to check if the three possible winning colors are equal. This function was borrowed from: http://www.coderslexicon.com/code/15/
        Parameters:
        grid - The matrix used to house the winning colors
        Returns:
        The winning Tic-Tac-4 color if there is a winner, null if there is not

      • findPanel

        private int[] findPanel(BoardPanel panel)
        Used to find a panel object's indexes in the Connect-4 panel matrix
        Parameters:
        panel - The Connect-4 panel to search for
        Returns:
        The indexes, inside an integer array, if the object is found. -1 if it is not

      • close_dialog

        private void close_dialog(java.lang.String caption)
        Used to show a JOptionPane asking whether or not the user wants to exit the game. Contains a customizable line.
        Parameters:
        caption - The caption for the dialog.
